title: How challenging is DBMS (CS 564) in terms of workload? What do I need to know besides the pre-reqs?
body: Im planning on taking DBMS over the summer in madison and i would like to know how challenging the workload is. Also, are there any conceptual prerequisites apart from the general course prereqs as mentioned in the student center?
comments:
If you are taking 564, avoid Ambuj like the plague... 

Other than that, materials for the course can be found at: http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~dbbook, you might want to get a copy of the 3rd edition if you haven't yet. 

The solution guide for the book is here: http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~dbbook/openAccess/thirdEdition/solutions/ans3ed-oddonly.pdf

and supporting materials such as tables and schema defs are here:
http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~dbbook/index.html.

Good luck!
If you know C/C++ and pay attention during class (assuming Jignesh is teaching it), its pretty straight forward. If you don't know C/C++, expect to spend some moderate time on the course projects.
I'm also planning on taking databases soon and I've found plenty of database concepts online that will help me prepare and perhaps lessen the workload.
